message.content:
Here is a sample healthy meal plan for the week that takes into consideration your dietary restrictions:

Monday:
Breakfast: Banana-Berry Smoothie (bananas, strawberries, blueberries, almond milk, and chia seeds)
Snack: Carrot sticks with hummus
Lunch: Quinoa Salad with Grilled Chicken (quinoa, mixed greens, grilled chicken, cherry tomatoes, cucumbers, red onion, olive oil, and lemon juice)
Dinner: Baked Sweet Potato with Black Bean and Avocado Salsa (baked sweet potato topped with black beans, avocado, corn, red onion, jalapeno, cilantro, lime juice, and olive oil)

Tuesday:
Breakfast: Scrambled Tofu with Spinach (tofu, spinach, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper)
Snack: Apple slices with sunflower seed butter
Lunch: Mediterranean Chickpea Salad (chickpeas, mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, olives, feta cheese, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper)
Dinner: Baked Tilapia with Roasted Asparagus and Red Pepper (baked tilapia with seasoning of choice, roasted asparagus, and sliced red peppers)

Wednesday:
Breakfast: Oatmeal with Fresh Fruit (oats cooked in water or almond milk, topped with fresh berries and a drizzle of maple syrup)
Snack: Sliced cucumber with guacamole
Lunch: Chicken Caesar Salad (mixed greens, grilled chicken, cherry tomatoes, croutons, parmesan cheese, and dressing made from olive oil, lemon juice, garlic powder, salt, and pepper)
Dinner: Stir-Fry with Tofu or Seitan (tofu or seitan, broccoli, carrots, bell peppers, snow peas, ginger, soy sauce, and rice)

Thursday:
Breakfast: Breakfast Burrito Bowl (scrambled eggs or tofu, mixed greens, black beans, salsa, avocado, and gluten-free tortilla chips on the side)
Snack: Celery sticks with almond butter
Lunch: Lentil Soup with Whole Grain Bread (lentil soup made with vegetables and herbs, served with whole grain bread)
Dinner: Grilled Salmon with Roasted Broccoli and Quinoa (grilled salmon seasoned with salt and pepper, roasted broccoli, and quinoa cooked in vegetable broth)

Friday:
Breakfast: Greek Yogurt Parfait (non-dairy yogurt alternative, mixed berries, chia seeds, and a sprinkle of hemp hearts)
Snack: Rice cakes with jam or honey-free nut butter
Lunch: Caprese Salad (tomato, fresh mozzarella, basil, balsamic glaze)
Dinner: Baked Veggie Quesadillas (gluten-free tortilla filled with black beans, roasted vegetables, salsa, and cheese-free cheese alternative, served with a side of guacamole)

Saturday:
Breakfast: Avocado Toast on Gluten-Free Bread (mashed avocado, gluten-free bread, and salt & pepper)
Snack: Bell pepper slices stuffed with hummus
Lunch: Vegan Stuffed Bell Peppers (bell peppers, brown rice, black beans, salsa, and cheese-free cheese alternative)
Dinner: Baked Chicken or Tofu Fajitas (chicken or tofu, bell peppers, onion, garlic powder, cumin, lime juice, and served with whole wheat tortillas)

Sunday:
Breakfast: Vegan Pancakes (made with non-dairy milk alternative, flour, baking powder, salt, and sweetener of choice)
Snack: Sliced pear with sunflower seed butter
Lunch: Grilled Vegetable Sandwich (gluten-free bread, grilled vegetables, avocado, lettuce, tomato, and Dijon mustard)
Dinner: Mixed Veggie Stir Fry (broccoli, carrots, bell peppers, mushrooms, onions, garlic powder, ginger, soy sauce, and rice)

Remember to always consult with a registered dietitian or healthcare professional before making significant changes to your diet.
